thread.title: Sharks' Raffi Torres suspended for hit: Report
thread.title_full: Sharks' Raffi Torres suspended for hit: Report

title: Sharks' Raffi Torres suspended for hit: Report
text:
San Jose Sharks forward Raffi Torres was suspended by the NHL, pending his disciplinary hearing with the league, for his hit on Anaheim Ducks forward Jakob Silfverberg, TSN reported Sunday. 
Torres received a match penalty for targeting Silfverberg's head on Saturday night. 
Torres sat out all of last season with a knee injury, and the start of Torres' season apparently will be delayed this year. 
Torres, 33, has been suspended four times in his NHL career previously. The most recent suspension came during the 2012-13 Stanley Cup playoffs, when he was banned for the rest of the Sharks' second-round series against the Los Angeles Kings for an illegal check to the head of Jarret Stoll. 
Silfverberg did not return to the game Saturday, but coach Bruce Boudreau said he was held out as a precaution. Sponsored Links
